title: [Large-Scale] Critical Instructional Design Inquiry: Methods for Designing Creative Language Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of learning theories and instructional design processes, language acquisition theories, and foundational grammar knowledge
context.additional_context: Strengthening instructional design capabilities in language learning contexts through participatory and collaborative design in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments: Focus on text-based interaction, vocabulary expansion, and contextual expressive skills enhancement.

learning_goals: Analyze at least three text organization and vocabulary utilization strategies in instructional design frameworks for language learning using participatory design processes.
Develop at least one learner-customized instructional design draft to enhance language expression and reading comprehension through collaborative workshop activities.
Apply critical design thinking to evaluate at least five strengths and weaknesses (grammatical, communicative, contextual) of existing language instructional design models.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
